definitions.definition: A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance , speech , etc.
examples: We joined the audience just as the lights went down.

definitions.definition: Hearing ; the condition or state of hearing or listening.
A widespread or nationwide viewing or listening public , as of a TV or radio network or program .
A formal meeting with a state or religious dignitary .
examples: She managed to get an audience with the Pope.

definitions.definition: The readership of a book or other written publication .
examples: "Private Eye" has a small but faithful audience .
The opera singer expanded his audience by singing songs from the shows.

definitions.definition: An audiencia (judicial court of the Spanish empire), or the territory administered by it.

main_definition: A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance , speech , etc. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) Hearing ; the condition or state of hearing or listening. [from 14th c.]
A widespread or nationwide viewing or listening public , as of a TV or radio network or program .
A formal meeting with a state or religious dignitary . [from 16th c.]
The readership of a book or other written publication . [from 19th c.]
( historical ) An audiencia (judicial court of the Spanish empire), or the territory administered by it.
